An Invisible Thread

Nathan tries to prevent Sylar from meeting the President. Sylar has his own agenda regarding his partner. Hiro finds there are consequences that come with the return of his powers.

Aired: 04/27/09
  • Summary
  • Reviews

Show Summary

Edit Summary »

Heroes is a serial saga about people all over the world discovering that they have superpowers and trying to deal with how this change affects their lives. Some of the superheroes who will be introduced to the viewing audience include Peter Petrelli, an almost 30-something male nurse who suspects he might be able... more »

Heroes is a serial saga about people all over the world discovering that they have superpowers and trying to deal with how this change affects their lives. Some of the superheroes who will be introduced to the viewing audience include Peter Petrelli, an almost 30-something male nurse who suspects he might be able to fly, Isaac Mendez, a 28-year-old junkie who has the ability to paint images of the future when he is high, Niki Sanders, a 33-year-old Las Vegas showgirl who begins seeing strange things in mirrors, Hiro Nakamura, a 24-year-old Japanese comic-book geek who literally makes time stand still, D.L. Hawkins, a 31-year-old inmate who can walk through walls, Matt Parkman, a beat cop who can hear other people's thoughts, and Claire Bennet, a 17-year-old cheerleader who defies death at every turn. As the viewing audience is discovering the nature of each hero's powers, the heroes themselves are discovering what having superpowers means to them as well as the larger picture of where their superpowers come from. Tune in each week to see how these heroes are drawn together by their common interest of evading the series' antagonist who wants to harvest their super-DNA for himself. Their ultimate destiny is nothing less than saving the world! The series will star Greg Grunberg (Alias), Leonard Roberts (Buffy the Vampire Slayer), Milo Ventimiglia (Gilmore Girls), and Hayden Panettiere (Ally McBeal, Guiding Light). Tim Kring (Crossing Jordan, Chicago Hope) is the series' creator. The pilot is set to be directed by Dave Semel (American Dreams, Buffy, the Vampire Slayer, Beverly Hills, 90210). Heroes will be produced by NBC/Universal/Tailwind.

Summary revised with help from: space-cowboy.less «

  • Why Do People Hate Volume 3???

    I've wondered this ever since Volume 3 finished: Why does EVERYONE seem to hate this Volume SO much?? I personally thoug...more »

    I've wondered this ever since Volume 3 finished: Why does EVERYONE seem to hate this Volume SO much?? I personally thought it was one of the best, if not the best . Volume 3 was fast paced, had awesome bad guys - Arthur, Flint, Knox, Doyle, etc. -, as well as cool new good guys - Daphne, Tracey - they brought back old characters - Meredith, Maury, Kaito, Adam etc -, it was probably the Volume with the best fight scenes, and it was just all around a different approach to 'people with powers' as they tried to actually give abilities to people. Now, obviously there were down sides, but I really don't think they outweigh all the good in the season. So... I'm just wondering: Why do you people seem to hate this Volume SO much??less «

  • Spoilers & Speculation about Volume 5: Redemption

    This worked well last time, so I see no reason to change anything. Standard rules for the thread are below. Have fun! The ...more »

    This worked well last time, so I see no reason to change anything. Standard rules for the thread are below. Have fun! The Spoilers & Speculation thread for Volume 4 can be found here . Also, some discussion about Volume 5 began before this thread was started. That can be found in the "Volume Five: Redemption" thread here and the "A spot of news about Volume 5" thread here . ------ Let's try to keep spoilers confined to this thread as much as possible. And remember that if a spoiler has to be part of any other conversation, please give as much warning as possible. To be clear, a spoiler is any piece of information that a viewer may not want to know if they haven't seen that episode yet. There is no time limit on spoilers. If it happened last year, it is still a spoiler to someone who is just now watching the DVDs. Of course we cannot shield any user from every possible spoiler, but if we try to label threads "SPOILERS" if we'll be talking about them, to avoid spoilers in the thread titles themselves, and to use the spoiler tags to hide any big ones that come up in conversation, that will let a lot new fans use the site and join in the conversations. Thanks! less «

Fans' Reviews

+Review This Show More Reviews »
  •  
    9 Superb

    Heroes is about once-ordinary people that discover they have powers and follows the battle of good and evil that ensues. Not as cheesy as it sounds, I promise. hide « show »

    So far I've only seen season 3, but I loved it and couldn't keep myself from eating them up in a few days. If people say season 3 was bad, I need to see the previous 2! I love the characters, their powers, how they deal with them, the setup of the chapters, and the badassery that never fails to show up in every episode. Claire's cool, Hiro and Ando are hilarious, Elle's simply awesome in every way, and Sylar's the villain that about everyone can't help but love. Hopefully I'll be able to see the first seasons soon, and I cannot wait for Volume 5!
    Do you agree?

    ThatRussianGirl Added 5 hrs, 34 mins ago All my reviews
  •  
    9.5 Superb

    Normal, everyday people wake up one day discovering that they have abilities. This show takes you into the lives of these people. You also have the few occasional bad guy and apocalypse that comes about, but that is just a normal day for these people. hide « show »

    This show is an amazing show. It seems that many people think the show has gone down hill, but I am remaining optimistic and choose to believe that the show will get better. That doesn't mean that the show is bad, because that is not true. I think the show will get better this next season. Plus, if you look back at any show, most likely you will see that every show hits a "rough patch" and has a time when it is still good, but not as good. These shows get better, so I believe Heroes will too. This last chapter in Heroes was good too. I am worried about what will happen to some of the characters, because you grow to love them, or you love to hate them. Either way, this show is one of my favorite shows and continues to have me as a devoted viewer every Monday evening. I even went out and bought a DVD recorder so that I could record this show and some of my other shows when they come on so that I don't miss them. I am anxiously awaiting the premiere of season four this September, and hope that everyone else is too.
    Do you agree?

  •  
    8.5 Great

    Good show the first 2 seasons I myself went to season 3 but bad acting and plot directions that didn't interest me made me bow out of the show. hide « show »

    Good show for the first 2 seasons I myself went to season 3 but bad acting and plot directions that didn't interest me made me bow out of the show. The program rose above it's comparisons to X-Men. The plot and characters unfolded beautifully with the regular people with extraordinary abilities. Watching each character come into their own was thrilling and seeing what new superpowers were out there was equally fun. Getting to know the characters and the twist and turns were fun for the first two seasons. For me though it became either a new twist on the same thing or just a plot leap I didn't care about. One example would be finding out there are multiple Nikki's and Sylar going from bad to good back to bad. I recommend the show for the first 2 seasons and it's ability to rise about standard tv and movie confines. Despite having a much used premise the show at least for a little while did manage to entertain and give us something new on the tv landscape.
    Do you agree?
      2 1
